item.description: BlueSky has a 300 character limit, which is less than the other services I cross-post to. This will be a problem when we eventually get peering working across twitter-like systems.
item.source:markdown: BlueSky has a 300 character limit, which is less than the other services I cross-post to. This will be a problem when we eventually get peering working across twitter-like systems.

item.description: I'm trying to understand "flex" in CSS, but it seems to be one of those things you have to understand before you can read about it. I'm interested because ChatGPT has told me to use it to solve some of my layout problems, and it's suggestions work, even though I don't understand how they work.
item.source:markdown: I'm trying to understand "flex" in CSS, but it seems to be one of those things you have to understand before you can read about it. I'm interested because ChatGPT has told me to use it to solve some of my layout problems, and it's suggestions work, even though I don't understand how they work.

item.description: I have a Tesla and Starlink, both bought before Elon Musk bought Twitter and revealed who he really is. I don't know anyone who works for a Musk company. How do they get up every day and try to do your best work for him.
item.source:markdown: I have a Tesla and Starlink, both bought before Elon Musk bought Twitter and revealed who he really is. I don't know anyone who works for a Musk company. How do they get up every day and try to do your best work for him.

item.description: Today in 2024, AI cannot create art. But a human being can use AI to create art. It's a medium, like paint and canvas except it's not static. It gets new skills all the time. I can't wait to see what it can do in a few months or years.
item.source:markdown: Today in 2024, AI cannot create art. But a human being can use AI to create art. It's a medium, like paint and canvas except it's not static. It gets new skills all the time. I can't wait to see what it can do in a few months or years.
